isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - FE 300, RE 200, RE 300 - RE 200/RE 300 CAB ACCESSORIES - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcprocinfo.para: Before beginning these test procedures, do the following:

item.para: Make sure the vehicle batteries are at 75% state of charge (SOC) or higher. This represents an open circuit voltage (OCV) of 12.4 volts. Batteries with an OCV of 12 volts or less are either completely discharged or have a dead cell.
Check any light or indicator lamp filaments that are suspected of being open (burned out). This is done to avoid unnecessary extensive circuit checks.
Inspect all connectors for loose or damaged pins, wires, etc. Refer to TEST EQUIPMENT AND CONNECTOR REPAIR section in GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the Master Service Manual.

When the technician determines that a fuse is blown, while checking its condition, he is directed to locate the cause of the overload condition and to repair it. While no further instruction on this procedure is listed in the diagnostic tables, the common procedure is as follows: isolate sections of the circuit by disconnecting connectors, and measure the resistance to ground to find the circuit that is shorted to ground. Then locate the damaged spot in the wire or connector and repair.

Diagnostics for circuits that are malfunctioning by sticking in the on position are generally not covered in detail. It is assumed that the technician knows to check for a malfunctioning switch, relay, or solenoid.

entry.para: Remove fuse F11 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Remove horn relay (R6) and re-install fuse F11. At relay connector, measure voltage from cavity 86 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A85, then repair.
At (R6) cavity 86, measure voltage from circuit A85 to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit A85/A85B, then repair.
At (R6) cavity 30, measure voltage from circuit A85B to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit A85B/A85, then repair.
Bench test horn relay by measuring resistance from cavity 30 to 87A.
Bench test horn relay by applying +12 volts to cavity 85, ground to cavity 86, and measuring resistance from cavity 30 to 87.
With horn button depressed, at (R6) measure voltage between circuit A85 cavity 86, and circuit A85A cavity 85.
Locate cause of open or poor connection in circuit A85A, horn harness conn. (14), pin 1, the blue wire, slip ring, the horn button or the steering column ground, then repair.
At (R6) use a test lead to jumper circuit A85A cavity 30 to A85C cavity 87. Does horn sound?
Install relay. Horn circuits check good.
Leave test lead connected and go to next step.
Disconnect horn harness connector (2), pin C4 and measure voltage from circuit A85C to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit A85C dash conn. (2), pin C4, then repair.
At (2), pin C4, measure voltage from circuit N85C to N85-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit N85-G/ N11-GG, then repair.
Reconnect (2), pin C4, and disconnect high-note horn connector (9151A). At (9151A)., measure voltage from circuit N85C (At (9151) circuit N85D w/dual horns) to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit N85C or N85D, then repair.
At (9151A), measure voltage from circuit N85C (circuit N85D w/dual horns) to circuit N85-G (N85-G w/dual horns).
(9151A), N85C or N85D to N85-G or N85-G
Locate open or poor connection in circuit N85-G or N85-G w/ dual horns), then repair. Install horn relay and reconnect (9151A).
Reconnect (9151A) and disconnect low-note horn connector (9151). At (9151), measure voltage from circuit N85D to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit N85D, then repair.
At (9151), measure voltage from circuit N85D to circuit N85-G.
Replace horn. Go to next step.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit N85D to N85-G, then repair.
Circuits check good. Reconnect (9151), and install horn relay.
Remove fuse F13 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F13, measure voltage from A14A/A14D to ground.
Install fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A14A/A14D, then repair. Install fuse.
Remove flasher (F35) and at socket, measure voltage from cavity B, circuit A55 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A55, then repair.
At socket (F35), install jumper from circuit A55 cavity B to A55A/A60A cavity A. Move turn lever to left and right turn positions. Then push hazard switch. Do lights illuminate at each position?
Turn signal/ hazard lights illuminate in each position.
Disconnect turn signal harness connector (13). At platform connector, measure voltage from cavity C, circuit A55A/A60A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A55A/A60A then repair.
Is vehicle equipped with a tilt steering column?

Move turn signal lever to left turn position. At turn signal connector (13), measure resistance from cavity C, circuit A55A/A60A to cavity D, circuit A56, and from cavity C, circuit A55A/A60A to cavity E, circuit A56A.
(13), cav. C, A55A/A60A to cav. D, A56 and cav. C A55A/A60A to cav. E, A56A.
Locate open in circuits A55A/A60A A56 or A56A, then repair. If none found, replace turn signal.

Move turn signal lever to right turn position. At turn signal connector (13), measure resistance from cavity C, circuit A55A/A60A to cavity A, circuit A57A and from cavity C, circuit A55A/A60A to cavity F, circuit A57.
(13), cav. C, A55A/A60A to cav. A, A57A and cav. C, A55A/A60A tocav. F, A57.
Locate open in circuit A57 or A57A, then repair. If none found, replace turn signal.
Push hazard switch and at (13), measure resistance from cavity C to all other cavities.
(13), cav. C to all other cavities.
Reconnect (13) and disconnect body builder connector (170). With turn signal lever in the left turn position, measure voltage from circuit A56A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A56A, then repair.
With turn signal lever in the right turn position, at (170), measure voltage from circuit A57A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A57A, then repair.
Reconnect (170) and disconnect body builder connector (169). With turn signal lever in the left turn position, measure voltage from circuit A56C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A56C/A56, then repair.
With turn signal lever in the right turn position, at (169), measure voltage from circuit A57C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A57C/A57, then repair.
Reconnect connector (169). Does left turn signal indicator illuminate when lever is moved to the left turn position?
Disconnect green dash cluster connector (11). With lever in left turn position, measure voltage from circuit A56B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A56B, then repair.
At (11), measure voltage across circuit A56B to circuit A28-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A28-G/ A11-G, then repair.
Circuits to left turn indicator check good. Reconnect (11) and with lever in left turn position, does indicator light illuminate?
Replace bulb and socket. If light still fails to illuminate, replace instrument cluster.
Does right turn signal indicator illuminate when lever is moved to the right turn position?
Disconnect green dash cluster connector (11). With lever in right turn position, measure voltage from circuit A57B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A57B, then repair.
At (11), measure voltage across circuit A57B to circuit A28-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A28-G/A11-G, then repair.
Circuits to right turn indicator check good. Reconnect (11) and with lever in right turn position, does indicator light illuminate?
Replace bulb and socket. If the light still fails to illuminate, replace instrument cluster.
Remove fuse F30 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F30, measure voltage from 14XZ to ground.
Install fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14XZ, then repair. Install fuse.
At the power source socket conn. (208), measure voltage from circuit 14XY to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 14XY, then repair.
At the power source socket conn. (208), measure voltage from circuit 14XX to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14XX to platform ground, then repair.
